verses.verse: And it came <S%H1961><s%> to pass in the month <S%H2320><s%> Nisan, <S%H5212><s%> in the twentieth <S%H6242><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of Artaxerxes <S%H783><s%> the king, <S%H4428><s%> that wine <S%H3196><s%> was before <S%H6440><s%> him: and I took <S%H5375><s%> up the wine, <S%H3196><s%> and gave <S%H5414><s%> it to the king. <S%H4428><s%> Now I had not been <S%H1961><s%> beforetime sad <S%H7451><s%> in his presence. <S%H6440><s%>

Why the king <S%H4428><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to me, Why <S%H4069><s%> is your countenance <S%H6440><s%> sad, <S%H7451><s%> seeing you are not sick? <S%H2470><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> is nothing <S%H369><s%> else but sorrow <S%H7455><s%> of heart. <S%H3820><s%> Then I was very <S%H3966><s%> sore <S%H7235><s%> afraid, <S%H3372><s%>

And said <S%H559><s%> to the king, <S%H4428><s%> Let the king <S%H4428><s%> live <S%H2421><s%> for ever: <S%H5769><s%> why <S%H4069><s%> should not my countenance <S%H6440><s%> be sad, <S%H7489><s%> when <S%H834><s%> the city, <S%H5892><s%> the place <S%H1004><s%> of my fathers' <S%H1><s%> sepulchers, <S%H6913><s%> lies waste, <S%H2720><s%> and the gates <S%H8179><s%> thereof are consumed <S%H398><s%> with fire? <S%H784><s%>
Then the king <S%H4428><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to me, For what <S%H4100><s%> do you make request? <S%H1245><s%> So I prayed <S%H6419><s%> to the God <S%H430><s%> of heaven. <S%H8064><s%>

And I said <S%H559><s%> to the king, <S%H4428><s%> If <S%H518><s%> it please <S%H2895><s%> the king, <S%H4428><s%> and if <S%H518><s%> your servant <S%H5650><s%> have found favor <S%H3190><s%> in your sight, <S%H6440><s%> that you would send <S%H7971><s%> me to Judah, <S%H3063><s%> to the city <S%H5892><s%> of my fathers' <S%H1><s%> sepulchers, <S%H6913><s%> that I may build <S%H1129><s%> it.

And the king <S%H4428><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to me, (the queen <S%H7694><s%> also sitting <S%H3427><s%> by him,) For how <S%H5704><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> shall your journey <S%H4109><s%> be? and when <S%H4970><s%> will you return? <S%H7725><s%> So it pleased <S%H3190><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> to send <S%H7971><s%> me; and I set <S%H5414><s%> him a time. <S%H2165><s%>

Moreover I said <S%H559><s%> to the king, <S%H4428><s%> If it please <S%H2895><s%> the king, <S%H4428><s%> let letters <S%H107><s%> be given <S%H5414><s%> me to the governors <S%H6346><s%> beyond <S%H5676><s%> the river, <S%H5104><s%> that they may convey <S%H5674><s%> me over <S%H5674><s%> till <S%H5704><s%> I come <S%H935><s%> into <S%H413><s%> Judah; <S%H3063><s%>

And a letter <S%H107><s%> to Asaph <S%H623><s%> the keeper <S%H8104><s%> of the king's <S%H4428><s%> forest, <S%H6508><s%> that he may give <S%H5414><s%> me timber <S%H6086><s%> to make beams <S%H7136><s%> for the gates <S%H8179><s%> of the palace <S%H1002><s%> which <S%H834><s%> appertained to the house, <S%H1004><s%> and for the wall <S%H2346><s%> of the city, <S%H5892><s%> and for the house <S%H1004><s%> that I shall enter <S%H935><s%> into. <S%H5921><s%> And the king <S%H4428><s%> granted <S%H5414><s%> me, according to the good <S%H2896><s%> hand <S%H3027><s%> of my God <S%H430><s%> on me.

Then I came <S%H935><s%> to the governors <S%H6346><s%> beyond <S%H5676><s%> the river, <S%H5104><s%> and gave <S%H5414><s%> them the king's <S%H4428><s%> letters. <S%H107><s%> Now the king <S%H4428><s%> had sent <S%H7971><s%> captains <S%H8269><s%> of the army <S%H2428><s%> and horsemen <S%H6571><s%> with me.

When Sanballat <S%H5571><s%> the Horonite, <S%H2772><s%> and Tobiah <S%H2900><s%> the servant, <S%H5650><s%> the Ammonite, <S%H5984><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> of it, it grieved <S%H7489><s%> them exceedingly <S%H1419><s%> that there was come <S%H935><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> to seek <S%H1245><s%> the welfare <S%H2896><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>
So I came <S%H935><s%> to Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> and was there <S%H8033><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> days. <S%H3117><s%>

And I arose <S%H6965><s%> in the night, <S%H3915><s%> I and some <S%H4592><s%> few <S%H4592><s%> men <S%H582><s%> with me; neither <S%H3808><s%> told <S%H5046><s%> I any man <S%H120><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> my God <S%H430><s%> had put <S%H5414><s%> in my heart <S%H3820><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> at Jerusalem: <S%H3389><s%> neither <S%H369><s%> was there any beast <S%H929><s%> with me, save <S%H3588><s%> <S%H518><s%> the beast <S%H929><s%> that I rode <S%H7392><s%> on.

And I went <S%H3318><s%> out by night <S%H3915><s%> by the gate <S%H8179><s%> of the valley, <S%H1516><s%> even before <S%H413><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the dragon <S%H8577><s%> well, <S%H5869><s%> and to the dung <S%H830><s%> port, <S%H8179><s%> and viewed <S%H7663><s%> the walls <S%H2346><s%> of Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> which <S%H834><s%> were broken <S%H6555><s%> down, and the gates <S%H8179><s%> thereof were consumed <S%H398><s%> with fire. <S%H784><s%>

Then I went <S%H5674><s%> on <S%H413><s%> to the gate <S%H8179><s%> of the fountain, <S%H5869><s%> and to the king's <S%H4428><s%> pool: <S%H1295><s%> but there was no <S%H369><s%> place <S%H4725><s%> for the beast <S%H929><s%> that was under <S%H8478><s%> me to pass. <S%H5674><s%>

Then went <S%H5927><s%> I up in the night <S%H3915><s%> by the brook, <S%H5158><s%> and viewed <S%H7663><s%> the wall, <S%H2346><s%> and turned <S%H7725><s%> back, <S%H7725><s%> and entered <S%H935><s%> by the gate <S%H8179><s%> of the valley, <S%H1516><s%> and so returned. <S%H7725><s%>

And the rulers <S%H5461><s%> knew <S%H3045><s%> not where <S%H575><s%> I went, <S%H1980><s%> or what <S%H4100><s%> I did; <S%H6213><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> had I as yet <S%H5704><s%> <S%H3651><s%> told <S%H5046><s%> it to the Jews, <S%H3064><s%> nor to the priests, <S%H3548><s%> nor to the nobles, <S%H2715><s%> nor to the rulers, <S%H5461><s%> nor to the rest <S%H3499><s%> that did <S%H6213><s%> the work. <S%H4399><s%>

Then said <S%H559><s%> I to them, You see <S%H7200><s%> the distress <S%H7451><s%> that we are in, how <S%H834><s%> Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> lies waste, <S%H2720><s%> and the gates <S%H8179><s%> thereof are burned <S%H3341><s%> with fire: <S%H784><s%> come, <S%H3212><s%> and let us build <S%H1129><s%> up the wall <S%H2346><s%> of Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> that we be no <S%H3808><s%> more <S%H5750><s%> a reproach. <S%H2781><s%>

Then I told <S%H5046><s%> them of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of my God <S%H430><s%> which <S%H834><s%> was good <S%H2896><s%> on me; as also <S%H637><s%> the king's <S%H4428><s%> words <S%H1697><s%> that he had spoken <S%H559><s%> to me. And they said, <S%H559><s%> Let us rise <S%H6965><s%> up and build. <S%H1129><s%> So they strengthened <S%H2388><s%> their hands <S%H3027><s%> for this good <S%H2896><s%> work.

But when Sanballat <S%H5571><s%> the Horonite, <S%H2772><s%> and Tobiah <S%H2900><s%> the servant, <S%H5650><s%> the Ammonite, <S%H5984><s%> and Geshem <S%H1654><s%> the Arabian, <S%H6163><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> it, they laughed <S%H3932><s%> us to scorn, and despised <S%H959><s%> us, and said, <S%H559><s%> What <S%H4100><s%> is this <S%H2088><s%> thing <S%H1697><s%> that you do? <S%H6213><s%> will you rebel <S%H4775><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> the king? <S%H4428><s%>

Then answered <S%H7725><s%> <S%H1697><s%> I them, and said <S%H559><s%> to them, The God <S%H430><s%> of heaven, <S%H8064><s%> he will prosper <S%H6743><s%> us; therefore we his servants <S%H5650><s%> will arise <S%H6965><s%> and build: <S%H1129><s%> but you have no <S%H369><s%> portion, <S%H2506><s%> nor right, <S%H6666><s%> nor memorial, <S%H2146><s%> in Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%>
